What is the difference between type 1 and type 2 diabetes?

Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease where the body attacks its own insulin-producing cells. Type 2 diabetes is a metabolic disorder where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough insulin to regulate blood sugar levels.
What are the risk factors for type 2 diabetes?
Some of the risk factors include being overweight or obese, lack of physical activity, high blood pressure, and family history of diabetes.
Can type 2 diabetes be cured?
There is no cure for type 2 diabetes, but it can be managed with lifestyle changes and medications.
